content: Thank you for the suggestion. However, the problem at the link appears to be unrelated. I can have and read emails with diacritics in other folders, but, although the folder with the name with diacritics can be created, it does not seem to be usable -- I cannot put emails into it.
creator: surlyc

content:
Deleting or renaming popstate.dat should force a download of all messages.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Popstate.dat

Rebuilding the sqlite file only resets the global search database in case search results are incorrect.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you for the quick response. I have given it a try, but it didn't have any effect. I note that the popstate.dat file hasn't been recreated either, at least not yet.

content:
I'm wondering whether I should take backup of the email account, delete the email entirely from the profile, and then re-add it, restoring the backup prior to allowing it to check the server for new messages.

creator: antaresbda

content: Gmail doesn't work like a normal POP server would. Messages are marked as already downloaded at the server. If you want already downloaded messages to be downloaded again, you have to use webmail and make that happen in Gmail Settings > Forwarding and POP/IMAP.
creator: DavidGG

content:
The simple answer is to turn auto-save off and tap Ctrl+S every few minutes to save what you've typed. But check first with an email addressed to yourself that Ctrl+S isn't having the same effect.

btw, are you getting emails from the recipients that they are receiving multiple emails? Are there multiple Sent emails in the Sent emails folder?
creator: frisée

content: Please provide screenshots of the errors you are getting. When you say 'lost', please explain what exactly that means. Is this an IMAP or POP account? Are you running Thunderbird on a computer, Mobile, Tablet or something else (please specify)? Which version of Thunderbird are you using? Which Operating System are you using?
creator: frisée

content: Do you get anything in the bottom left corner when you click on 'Get Messages'? If you add the 'Get Messages' button in View/Toolbars/Customise, does this have the same effect? Do you have Messages to be automatically retrieved )Hamburger Icon/Account Settings/Server Settings/Check for new messages every AND Automatically download...) ?

content: I can't help with the Beta version as I don't run it. But there is a difference between the different search windows in Thunderbird and what they search in. Details are here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/quick-filter-toolbar https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/global-search Not sure if you're using the incorrect search window but these articles should help.
creator: frisée
